#Text=The Washington Wizards ( 7 - 8 ) defeated the Cleveland Cavaliers ( 13 - 5 ) 97 - 85 on Tuesday , handing the Cavs their first home loss of the 2015 - 16 campaign .
#Text=The Wizards had been mired in an offensive slump of epic proportions recently , having scored 87 points or less over their last three games .

#Text=If they were going to pull off the near - unimaginable Tuesday by upsetting the undefeated Cavs in Quicken Loans Arena , they would need a resurgent performance from their offensive linchipin , John Wall .

#Text=The All-Star 's recent performances had served as a microcosm of the team 's overall offensive struggles , with Wall having tallied 20 points or less in all 11 of Washington 's November contests , and having scored in single digits twice over that span .
#Text=However , the light went on for the Wizards ' point guard on Tuesday , as he exploded for a season - high 35 points and added 10 assists , four rebounds and five steals .
#Text=After shooting 36 percent or worse in four of his preceding five games , the 25 - year - old enjoyed a stellar night from the field , draining 14 buckets in 24 attempts ( 58 percent ) .

#Text=If Wall can begin to put together more efforts of this caliber , the Wizards have an opportunity to climb out of their early - season hole and eventually grab an Eastern Conference playoff spot .
#Text=Wall 's backcourt mate Bradley Beal posted his fifth consecutive game with double - digit points to support the offensive cause , amassing 18 points , nine rebounds and six assists .

#Text=Marcin Gortat pitched in with his second consecutive double - double and third in four games , totaling an impressive 15 points , 11 rebounds , four blocks and a steal versus a Cleveland defense that had come into Tuesday yielding the second - least points and the least amount of rebounds per game to opposing centers .
#Text=Jared Dudley fared better in his second start at power forward , collecting 12 points , three assists and a pair of rebounds , after only totaling seven points on Saturday versus the Raptors .

#Text=Otto Porter ( six points , five rebounds , two assists , one block ) was the only Washington starter in single digits , while Garrett Temple paced the reserves with seven points and five rebounds over 28 minutes .
#Text=The Wizards improved to 7 - 8 but still reside in last place in the Eastern Conference 's Southeast Division .
#Text=They head home to face the Lakers on Wednesday .
#Text=LeBron James unsurprisingly led the Cavs in every offensive category , but Tuesday was a night where that simply was not enough .
#Text=A key factor was the lack of support from James ' season - long wing man in Kyrie Irving 's absence , Kevin Love .

#Text=While James was able to put together one of his typically stellar outings ( 24 points , 13 rebounds , four assists , a block and a steal ) , Love could only muster eight points , eight rebounds and a steal over 33 minutes .
#Text=The fact that the Wizards had come in to Tuesday 's game giving up the fifth - most points per game to opposing power forwards ( 22 ) made Love 's final stat line all the more disappointing .
#Text=J.R.
#Text=Smith ( 13 points ) and Mo Williams ( 12 points ) did their best to contribute , but Smith in particular suffered through a third consecutive sub - par shooting night ( 3 - for - 14 ) .
#Text=Matthew Delladedova paced the Cavs ' bench with a 15 - point effort over 27 minutes .
#Text=Cleveland fell to 13 - 5 but still retains sole possession of first place in the Eastern Conference 's Central Division .
#Text=They head to New Orleans to face the Pelicans on Friday .
